tasks: Randomness and Turbulence of Incompressible Fluids
results: Existence of infinite non-trivial regular solutions for incompressible static Euler equations
Existence of random solutions of incompressible static Euler equations
Path limits of corresponding Navier-Stokes flows
Non-existence of double limits of Navier-Stokes flows
Non-unique solutions of periodic pipeline Euler flow
Global well-posedness of NS periodic solution
title: Non-uniqueness of Regular Solutions for Incompressible Static Euler Equations with Given Boundary Co.pdf
abstract: . The incompressible Navier-Stokes equations and static Euler equations are considered. We ﬁnd that there exist inﬁnite non-trivial regular solutions of in- compressible static Euler equations with given boundary conditions. Moreover there exist random solutions of incompressible static Euler equations. Provided Reynolds number is large enough and time variable t goes to inﬁnity, these random solutions of static Euler equations are the path limits of corresponding Navier-Stokes ﬂows. But the double limits of these Navier-Stokes ﬂows do not exist. These phenomena reveal randomness and turbulence of incompressible ﬂuids. Therefore these solutions are called turbulent solutions. Here some typing models without Prandtl layer are given. 1. Introduction The incompressible Navier-Stokes equations in R3 are given by (1.1) ut −ν∆u + (u · ∇)u + ∇P = 0, (1.2) ∇· u = 0, where u = u(t, x) = �u1(t, x), u2(t, x), u3(t, x)  and P = P(t, x) stand for the unknown velocity vector ﬁeld of ﬂuid and its pressure, ν > 0 is the coeﬃcient of viscosity. Here x = (x1, x2, x3), ∇= (∂1, ∂2, ∂3) and ∂j = ∂ ∂xj (j = 1, 2, 3). Taking curl with equation (1.1), we have (1.3) ωt −ν∆ω + (u · ∇)ω −(ω · ∇)u = 0. Here vorticity ω = (ω1, ω2, ω3) and ω(t, x) =∇× u(t, x). (1.4) The incompressible static Euler equations in R3 are given by (1.5) (u · ∇)u + ∇P = 0, (1.6) ∇· u = 0. By taking curl, the equation (1.5) is equivalent to (1.7) (u · ∇)ω −(ω · ∇)u = 0. 2000 Mathematics Subject Classiﬁcation. 35Q30, 76D05, 76F02, 37L20. Key words and phrases. Incompressible Navier-Stokes Equations, Incompressible Static Euler Equa- tions, Randomness and Turbulence of Incompressible Fluids, Typing Models without Prandtl Layer. 1
